      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyString() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void flipCaseInSubstring(int startPosition, int endPosition)
      Changes the case of the alphabetic characters in the current string, between startPosition and endPosition (included), with 1 being the first position: - lower case characters are replaced with the corresponding upper case characters - upper case characters are replaced with the corresponding lower case characters
      char getCharacter(int position)
      Returns the character at position "position" in the string, with 1 being the first position
      java.lang.String getString()
      Returns the current string
      java.lang.String getVowels()
      Returns a string that consists of all the vowels in the current string, in the same order and with the same case.
      int numberOfVowels()
      Returns the number of vowels in the current string ("y" is not considered a vowel)
      void setString(java.lang.String string)
      Sets the value of the current string.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

      • flipCaseInSubstring

        public void flipCaseInSubstring(int startPosition,
                       int endPosition)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                IllegalIndexException
        Description copied from interface: MyStringInterface
        Changes the case of the alphabetic characters in the current string, between startPosition and endPosition (included), with 1 being the first position: - lower case characters are replaced with the corresponding upper case characters - upper case characters are replaced with the corresponding lower case characters
        Specified by:
        flipCaseInSubstring in interface MyStringInterface
        Parameters:
        startPosition - Position of the first character to consider
        endPosition - Position of the last character to consider
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If either "startPosition" or "endPosition" are invalid (e.g., "startPosition" <= 0, "endPosition" <= 0, "startPosition" > "endPosition")
        IllegalIndexException - If the string has less than "endPosition" characters in it
